intro: Pleiarina woodii var. wilmsii, commonly known as the Wilmsii pleiarina, is a rare and unique plant species native to specific regions of Mexico. It belongs to the Asteraceae family, characterized by its composite flower heads composed of both ray and disk florets. The plant typically grows in rocky, well-drained soils and thrives in arid or semi-arid environments. Its foliage consists of narrow, linear leaves that are often covered in a fine layer of white hairs, which help reduce water loss. The flowers are usually pale yellow to orange, contributing to its ornamental value in horticultural settings.
